last_50_posts.content:
We really should just start reciting commandments (pick one, there are ten), and asking people where they stand on that idea.

"So, this whole 'thou shalt not steal' concept. What are your thoughts on that?" and then see where the conversation goes from there.

Reference:

“I am the Lord thy God, thou shalt not have any gods before Me.”

“Thou shalt not take the name of the Lord thy God in vain.”

“Remember to keep holy the Sabbath day.”

“Honor thy father and mother.”

“Thou shalt not kill.”

“Thou shalt not commit adultery.”

“Thou shalt not steal.”

“Thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbor.”

“Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor’s wife.”

“Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor’s goods.”

As if FOX News fans can't recite the side effects of every prescription medication made, right?

They're all about that gaseous oily discharge & shit. Actual shit. But, for some reason, they're extremely happy people. [insert Tucker laugh]

We need to pick a Step One. What is Step One towards making America first again?

If you need an example, I'm looking for ideas like "Let's get dual citizen politicians out of American government." Stuff like that. I know we have a long list, but we have to pick a Step One and take that step.

What is Step One?

Gab is the Constitution as a website. It's sort of actually America actually online. You just don't have mail.

Anyway, with that in mind, let's explore some stuff:

Politicians can't use Gab
TWO social networks have been launched
This is a lot of effort...to just not join Gab
Trump won't join Gab
Trump won't join Parler
Trump won't join GETTR
Trump won't join FreeTalk 45 - which is his number
Trump did join Rumble, but they had to ban "hate speech"
Trump will be launching yet another platform
This is getting complex. It seems unnecessarily complex. Just, as a programmer, I can look at this and see many ways to optimize it and make it more simple.

But, these are politicians and corporate media people. We have to keep that fun fact in mind. So, really - what are we even expecting?

This is all politics and corporate globalist media. How can we expect anything but an absolute fustercluck?

"It's an absolute fustercluck."

"Yes."

last_50_posts.content:
The opposite of "plastic perfect" and I mean literally. Most product shoots are of models - not food. McDonald's, Burger King, almost every restaurant - you're often not even looking at food. You're looking at airbrushed food or a model of food created by an artist for the camera lens.

The opposite of that is real food. But, companies like McDonald's and Burger King can't do that. You'd never show up in their restaurant. They can't show you what you'll actually get. And that's because it's genuinely horrible.

Ever notice that McDonald's commercials never show you a person being served fresh, hot food on a plate? They're being served a logo on a folded bag you can't see inside of, or they are served a STUFFED WRAPPER that you also can't see inside. Their "food" maybe gets shown for one second in the commercial - and that was a plastic model.

They do that because their "product" can not compete with this. It would have no hope. If I un-wrap a McBurger and set it next to [see attached], which do you choose? Right. So, McDonald's has been knowingly lying to you for decades. What else might McDonald's and companies like them be lying about?

Stop living the lie and give this a try:
